tool.name: SAGA.grid_spline.5
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayGRID False isArrayTARGET_TEMPLATE False output_data_TARGET_OUT_GRID $output_data_TARGET_OUT_GRID name SAGA.grid_spline.5 GRID $GRID TARGET_DEFINITION $TARGET_DEFINITION TARGET_USER_SIZE $TARGET_USER_SIZE TARGET_USER_XMIN $TARGET_USER_XMIN TARGET_USER_XMAX $TARGET_USER_XMAX TARGET_USER_YMIN $TARGET_USER_YMIN TARGET_USER_YMAX $TARGET_USER_YMAX TARGET_USER_COLS $TARGET_USER_COLS TARGET_USER_ROWS $TARGET_USER_ROWS TARGET_USER_FITS $TARGET_USER_FITS TARGET_TEMPLATE $TARGET_TEMPLATE METHOD $METHOD EPSILON $EPSILON LEVEL_MAX $LEVEL_MAX UPDATE $UPDATE DATATYPE $DATATYPE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_TARGET_OUT_GRID $OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID.outputType_TARGET_OUT_GRID transmissionMode_TARGET_OUT_GRID $OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID.transmissionMode_TARGET_OUT_GRID

param.name: GRID
param.label: Grid
param.help: Grid The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: TARGET_USER_COLS
param.label: Columns
param.help: Number of cells in East-West direction.

param.name: TARGET_USER_ROWS
param.label: Rows
param.help: Number of cells in North-South direction.

param.name: TARGET_TEMPLATE
param.label: Target System
param.help: use this grid's system for output grids The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, tiff, png

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_TARGET_OUT_GRID
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Multilevel B-spline algorithm for spatial interpolation of scattered data as proposed by Lee, Wolberg and Shin (1997). The algorithm makes use of a coarse-to-fine hierarchy of control lattices to generate a sequence of bicubic B-spline functions, whose sum approaches the desired interpolation function. Large performance gains are realized by using B-spline refinement to reduce the sum of these functions into one equivalent B-spline function. <br/><br/>The 'Maximum Level' determines the maximum size of the final B-spline matrix and increases exponential with each level. Where level=10 requires about 1mb level=12 needs about 16mb and level=14 about 256mb(!) of additional memory.
